data.title: Awesome Brisket - Cool Atmosphere
data.text: My husband went here first with a group and raved about it. We since have dropped in after 8 pm twice and they were out of brisket so we didn't stay. I'm a brisket gal. Two nights ago we finally had a chance to go and I'm so glad we did. There were four of us in the party and we went at 6pm. Plenty of brisket I was glad to see. I had a sliced brisket sandwich and a side of slaw and corn nuggets. It was just really delicious. They tend to have live music beginning at 7pm and I am not a fan of that. We had just finished up our meal when the guy was setting up. I like to eat my meal and talk with my friends. One of the prior stop-ins we encountered the live music and it was just too loud; I was glad they were out of brisket. I wasn't tempted to stay and suffer through the noise. The singer was fine enough; it just isn't my thing but there were quite a few people there enjoying him. I liked that there were numerous games where you could sit and play and just have a family night. The building next door has been torn down and it appears that they have made it into an extra outdoor eating area with a stage. Perhaps on weekends the crowds make there way out to enjoy outdoor music. Also, I should mention that they make their own Root Beer; you can purchase it at the bar and it is good. One con to me is that the sauce is available by the drinks and it is cold. I like my sauce warm. I didn't inquire if I could get a side of warm sauce. Next time I will because there will be a next time. Really proud of Garland for adding this establishment to their little town square. Now there are at least 5 great places to get meals downtown Garland.

data.title: D Magazine Event
data.text: We were invited to an event held by D Magazine at Intrinsic and greatly enjoyed it. Nice to have great BBQ close to home and the atmosphere was also very good. Great BBQ, fried okra, mac and cheese, and all the rest of the food was equally good. If you live in the Dallas area, come and visit us in Garland.

data.title: Good beer and great food
data.text: Great place for beer and food.  Best service, and great food.  Neat building, nice outside area.  Would go back again.

data.title: This place is Smokin'!
data.text:
We stumbled on this treasure one night while looking for a place to eat with friends. I'm so glad one of my 'reading the map wrong' brought us to the right place!  The food was wonderful!  Get ready though because this is your usual food dive.  You find your own seat, which depending on how busy it is may mean waiting or eating outside. OR, if you are a small party and there is another table with a small party, you may can nicely ask to sit at their table.  That's how it works there!    Just remember this - they serve HUGE portions of meat!  I had the smoked chicken and brought half home. Hubs ate the ribs and they were finger lickin' good.

It's located on the old, downtown square.  Go on a Saturday night and you may can hear the old timers (and youngins) picking and grinning (i.e. playing the guitar, banjos and fiddles).

It was a very good dining experience and we will return next time we are in that neck of the woods.

data.title: Great place for BBQ and Beer
data.text: We love this place.  Come here usually once a week.  The brisket is truly awesome!  They cook over night.  They brew their own beer and sell some other local breweries.

data.title: Good barbeque; funky setting
data.text:
Located on the north side of the square in downtown Garland, Intrinsic is housed in an old commercial building with concrete floors and brick walls.  Its patio dining area occupies a similar but roofless adjacent building.  There's abundant seating space both inside and out, a long, shiny bar, and a menu of excellent barbecue.  We opted for the brown bag special, a 1/2 pound sandwich of either brisket or pulled pork, house-made potato chips and a drink for $8.99.  It was enough food for two, with the perfect level of smokiness and tenderness. You can help yourself to a selection of pickles, onions, and bbq sauce in four levels of spiciness.  On my next visit, I want to try one of the plates, priced in the $14 range.  

We're not beer drinkers, so I can't comment on the Brewery side of the business, but we'll be back for more barbecue.

data.title: Great Barbecue
data.text:
Went here twice on my recent trip to Mesquite, and was very impressed. The briquet was simply amazing! The pulled pork was great! And I hear the chicken wings are enormous. 

For sides the greens, beans, and creamed cord with jalapeño were excellent. 

Match that with an on-site brewery, and a great selection of other beers, ciders, sangria and wine on tap and you've got a match made in heaven. 

This is not a high-end restaurant, you be served on a metal tray with a piece of wax paper on top, and eat with plastic utensils. To make things easy, start a tab at the bar before you order your food. 

Prices are reasonable, a meat plate and a beer will set you back $20.00.  

I hope to go back soon.

data.title: Recommend
data.text: I always like to try the local brews when out of town and Intrinsic did not disappoint. I would call this a micro brewery with really good food. It is a very relaxed atmosphere which I feel sets a brewpub apart from a restaurant or bar. A couple of their brews were sold out, but they had plenty of choices from other local breweries. I had the brisket and ribs, both excellent. It is located in downtown Garland, which was a little ways from the airport, but well worth the trip.

data.title: Great food and drinks
data.text: Great bbq ! Their sides are also delicious. My husband loves their beers and I like that they also have wine for the non beer drinkers. I will come back again for sure .

data.title: Birthday fun
data.text: I requested to go here for my birthday.  Great atmosphere, FOOD, and of course the beer!  They are great in letting you taste test the beer before deciding.  Never disappointed when we go there.  Love the outside patio to hang with friends and family. Have board games you can play as well. Also  have entertainment on some nights.  Closed on Monday's for brewing.

data.title: Quick Pit Stop
data.text: We were staying in Garland for a quick overnight on our way to Austin. This was pretty close to our hotel. Without much expectation or research we decided to give it a try. What a pleasant surprise. Decent craft beers and some tasty BBQ. There was a guy playing piano and singing tunes and the place was reasonably packed for a Thursday night. There was some interesting art on display and everything about the place was just a little 'different' than a typical Texas BBQ joint. given the chance I would definitely eat here again.

data.title: Nice way to spend a Saturday afternoon.
data.text: Met family for a small gathering.  All ages and everyone enjoyed. Clean, friendly and very fast service.  Very casual place.

data.title: Great atmosphere, but a little pricy.
data.text:
This place is usually busy, but no waiting for a table.  The decor is rustic and charming.
They had an entertainer playing guitar softly for tips which was nice.  You go to the counter at the back to place your order and they bring your food to you.  Because they are also a brewery, they have unique brewed beers and root beer which seem to please.  Then, they have a patio looking onto the downtown square.  A nice surprise is their  specialties of BBQ pizza, nachos, meat sundaes, flatbreads, etc..., however they are only served after 3:00 p.m.  The best thing I liked was the games.  They have cards, board games, dominoes, etc... Available for people to play after eating.  I enjoyed playing a game of scrabble after lunch with my son.  Atmosphere is laid back and people can hang out playing games during non peak times.  Overall, everything was good, although the menu is sort of pricey compared to other BBQ places such as Dickies or Spring Creek BBQ.

data.title: Good beer, food and environment
data.text: They have unique beers that are pretty good... the brisket is very good too. Most brewery's in DFW don't have food on sight, so a nice combo! Love the decor and casual vibe hang out. Live music some nights. Open air beer garden is cool to play Jenga.

data.title: Great food and friendly service
data.text: Visited on a Saturday for lunch with some friends. The atmosphere is relaxed and service is friendly. The bar at the front has a good selection of local brews and a few of their own. To order food, walk up to the counter in the back. We had the pulled pork sandwich and macaroni and cheese. Both were excellent! The sandwich was huge so I recommend sharing one between two people. Once you've got your food there are plenty of tables inside and on the patio. We ate outside and the weather was wonderful! Highly recommend as a dinner/lunch spot or a place to hang out to have a beer with friends. Will definitely be back!

data.title: Great BBQ, Great brews! Excellent Value!
data.text: Intrinsic came highly recommended to us from some good friends.  We were not disappointed.  The food was great, and there was so much on the plate that we were able to share and walk away full!  My husband loves craft beers and found a great one the night we were there.  We will be back to enjoy the food, live music and great brews!

data.title: Great Beers
data.text: The staff know their beers. Kind of a hipster place to hang out and have a beer there. They do sell barbecue there which is ok not the best. The smoke ring was ok on the meat but the rub was so over powering that it killed the meat flavor

data.title: Be here or be nowhere!
data.text: Great beers and awesome brisket!  It's beyond worth it!  Margaritas, beer, and wine on tap. This place is great.

data.title: Dinner with the fam
data.text: If your ever close to downtown Garland Tx this is a great place for lunch or dinner. It has a microbrewery in it as well as great barbecue. Not your typical Texas barbecue joint it kinda has a hipster feel to it. But don't be mistaken the food is great and the beer is cold. Free samples are given for the beers on tap.

data.title: I bet they have really good beer
data.text: Working near downtown Garland and I love barbecue so I gave it a try. Your food is served in a Styrofoam to-go container and cafeteria style so if you know what you want service is pretty quick. It was a workday so no chance to taste the beer but there were plenty of people that seem to be drinking so maybe next time. The barbecue was slightly smoky and had just the right amount of moisture. No need to cut it with a knife because you can cut it with your plastic fork.
